author: Chandra Philip
description: Canadian country star Shania Twain says marshaling this year’s Calgary Stampede parade was a long-time dream come true. Twain led the parade wearing a white cowboy hat and white fringed jacket and riding a white horse. The parade included 30 floats, nine marching bands, and more than 700 horses walking the five-kilometre route in downtown […]
title: Country Star Shania Twain Says Leading Calgary Stampede Parade a Long-Time Dream

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Another heat event will return to most of southern Ontario this weekend, according to a warning issued by Environment Canada. The federal agency has issued a heat warning for July 5 to 6 as humidex values are expected make it feel like 40 degrees across southern Ontario.  The heat event will span from Windsor to […]
title: Environment Canada Issues Another Heat Warning for Southern Ontario This Weekend

author: Matthew Horwood
description: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Peter Hoekstra says the United States won’t commit to reaching a new trade agreement with Ottawa by July 21, a date cited by Prime Minister Mark Carney as the target for a deal. Hoekstra added that Canada will likely have to pay “some level of tariff” like all countries. “I’m not […]
title: US Ambassador Not Committing to July 21 Trade Deal Target Cited by Carney

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada’s housing agency is updating its definition of affordability as the issue of unaffordable housing persists across the country. The agency says restoring affordability to levels experienced in the last two decades “isn’t realistic.” “As a result, we’re changing our aspiration to restoring affordability to levels seen just before the pandemic,” says a July 3 […]
title: Canadian Housing Agency Changes Definition of Affordability

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative MP Larry Brock has launched a petition calling for the Liberal government to reform Canada’s bail system and repeal “soft-on-crime” legislation, citing an increase in violent crime over the last decade. “Increasingly, it’s repeat, violent offenders committing these crimes; individuals who never should have been back on the streets in the first place,” the […]
title: Tory MP Launches Petition to Reform Canada’s Bail System

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Details are now emerging in the case of a B.C. man sentenced to 11 years in prison for possessing large amounts of fentanyl and cocaine for the purpose of trafficking. A July 2 sentencing decision from Justice Andrew Majawa revealed the events leading to the arrest and conviction of 45-year-old Jason Conrad who admitted to two […]
title: BC Man Gets 11-Year Sentence for Trafficking Fentanyl and Cocaine

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Ramping is said to occur anytime an ambulance spends more than 30 minutes waiting outside a hospital for its patient to be admitted.
title: WA Ambulance Ramping Tops 5,100 Hours a Month, AMA Urges National Fix

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A federal board that provides recommendations to Parks Canada has advised against commemorating Canada’s first prime minister with new historic plaques, saying it would be too “polarizing and controversial.” The Historic Sites and Monuments Board made the recommendation against plaques being erected to honour Sir John A. Macdonald in December 2023, as recorded by minutes […]
title: Federal Board Recommended Against Honouring Canada’s First Prime Minister, Calling It Too ‘Controversial,’ Records Show

author: The Canadian Press
description: Plane-leasing companies that seized four aircraft from Flair Airlines in 2023 are seeking damages from the budget carrier, alleging it failed to make rent payments by the deadline and ignored repeated default notices. The allegations were detailed in a statement of defence and counterclaim for US$30.9 million filed in Ontario Superior Court on June 26. […]
title: Leasing Companies Allege Flair Failed to Make Rent Payments, Ignored Default Notices

author: The Canadian Press
description: Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson has announced $21.5 million in federal funding for five Alberta projects that aim to lower the cost of capturing and storing carbon dioxide emissions. The projects are being funded under the Energy Innovation Program, which put out a call for carbon capture, utilization and storage technology proposals. Bow Valley Carbon […]
title: Ottawa Announces Funding for Five Alberta Carbon Capture Projects

author: The Canadian Press
description: Industry Minister Mélanie Joly says the federal government is talking to mining and metals giant Rio Tinto about helping the company with cash flow problems caused by the United States’ global steel and aluminum tariffs. During a visit to Saguenay, Que., on Thursday to meet with businesses in the province’s critical aluminum sector, Joly told […]
title: Ottawa Talking to Metals Giant Rio Tinto About Cash Flow Help Amid U.S. Tariffs

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Zelenskyy said the two leaders discussed defense cooperation as the Pentagon reassesses arms support amid Russia's continued attacks against Ukraine.
title: Trump, Zelenskyy Hold Call on Strengthening Ukraine’s Air Defenses Amid Russian Strikes

author: Adam Morrow
description: Bilateral ties have been frosty since last December, when Baku accused Russian forces of accidentally downing an Azerbaijani commercial airliner.
title: Already Shaky, Russia–Azerbaijan Relations Worsen Amid Tit-for-Tat Arrests

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A brand of anchovy fillets is being recalled in multiple provinces due to elevated histamine levels. Quebec company Cucina Fine Foods is recalling Vicente Marino branded anchovy fillets following reports of adverse reactions after consumption of the product, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) said in a July 3 recall notice. The anchovy fillets were […]
title: High Histamine Levels Prompt Nationwide Recall of Anchovy Fillets

author: Dorothy Li
description: The decision to exempt major European liquor makers from the duties came as China's top diplomat met with European leaders.
title: China Imposes Tariffs on EU Brandy, Exempts Major Producers

author: Guy Birchall
description: The U.N. nuclear watchdog's relationship with the regime in Tehran has grown increasingly tense since Israel attacked enrichment facilities three weeks ago.
title: IAEA Pulls Nuclear Inspectors out of Iran

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A nationwide arrest warrant has been issued by the Mounties for an alleged cocaine trafficker from Quebec with a long history of drug-related arrests. The RCMP issued a warrant for André Chartrand of Notre-Dame-de-la-Merci, Que., on July 4 after the accused drug trafficker failed to appear at his trial, scheduled to begin late last month. […]
title: RCMP Issues Canada-Wide Arrest Warrant for Suspected Quebec Cocaine Trafficker

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: When William Rew left Montreal at age 30 in 1983 to fly aid missions in Ethiopia, he never expected it would help spark one of the largest charity broadcasts of all time two years later. Rew joined up to deliver food and medicine to drought- and famine-stricken Ethiopia in late 1983 and throughout 1984 with […]
title: Canadian Pilot Recalls Ethiopia Mission That Helped Spark Historic Live Aid Concert 40 Years Ago

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The federal government’s spending plans could result in the country hitting an average yearly deficit of $78 billion over the next four years, adding approximately $350 billion to Canada’s debt in what a new report calls a potential “deteriorating fiscal outlook.” The country’s deficit will hit $92 billion in 2025–26 because of the Liberal government’s […]
title: Canada’s Deficit Could Average $78 Billion Over 4 Years as Finances ‘Deteriorate’: Think Tank

author: Michael Bonner
description: Commentary The 21st century is going to be overshadowed by a crisis that human beings have never faced before. I don’t mean war, pestilence, famine or climate change. Those are perennial troubles. Yes, even climate change, despite the hype, is nothing new as anyone who’s heard of the Roman Warm Period, the Mediaeval Warm Period, […]
title: Canada Desperately Needs a Baby Bump

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario continues to see a reduction in measles cases after months of escalating numbers, the latest data shows. Public Health Ontario (PHO) reported 12 new cases in the province as of July 2, a decrease from the 33 cases reported last week and the 96 cases from the week before that. Four more people were […]
title: New Measles Case Count on Decline in Ontario, Public Health Data Indicates

author: Guy Birchall
description: 550 drones and missiles were involved in the overnight barrage, which primarily targeted the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv.
title: Russia Launches Largest Aerial Assault on Ukraine Since War Began

author: The Canadian Press
description: Two suspects have been arrested in British Columbia in an investigation into widespread extortion of South Asian business figures, crimes that police and politicians say reach back to India. RCMP in Surrey, B.C., say the suspects were arrested Thursday on arson and firearms allegations dating from late 2023 into 2024. Victims of the crimes have […]
title: BC Police Arrest Two Over Extortion Involving South Asian Community

author: The Canadian Press
description: The northern Manitoba town of Lynn Lake has issued a mandatory evacuation order as a nearby wildfire threatens to cause an imminent loss of power to the community. The evacuation begins Friday, though officials haven’t provided a time for when residents must be out of their homes. The town says it is offering transportation for […]
title: Northern Manitoba Town Orders Evacuation as Wildfire Threatens Power

author: Alex Wu
description: The two-tiered trade deals will become the new norm to contain China’s dumping, analysts predicted.
title: Vietnam Signs Trade Deal With US Despite China’s Warnings, More Countries May Follow: Experts

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The U.S. Coast Guard has said that it needs a fleet of eight to nine polar icebreakers to ensure access to the polar regions.
title: Congress’s Bill Allocates $8.6 Billion for Coast Guard Icebreakers to Boost Arctic Presence

author: Chris Summers
description: The Russian Foreign Ministry said the official recognition of the Taliban as Afghanistan's government would foster 'productive bilateral cooperation.'
title: Russia Officially Recognizes Taliban as Government of Afghanistan

author: C.P. Champion
description: Commentary Louis Riel has long been called by some the Father of Manitoba. Though the province’s website is equivocal (saying only that he is “widely regarded” as such), last year Manitoba one-upped itself. Supposedly “correcting history,” Premier Wab Kinew declared Riel the province’s “first Premier”—a position that not even Riel imagined he ever held and […]
title: The Real Father of Manitoba

author: Owen Evans
description: The terror group Hamas is weighing a final cease-fire deal which is being brokered by Egypt and Qatar, backed by the United States.
title: Trump Says He Expects Hamas Decision in 24 Hours on Cease-Fire Proposal

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Hundreds of rare frogs have been released west of Canberra in an effort to bring the species back from the brink.
title: Taronga Zoo Frees 544 Rare Frogs Into the Wild

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The State Department said it was recalling the U.S. envoy due to what it called ‘baseless and reprehensible statements’ from the Colombian government.
title: US, Colombia Announce Recall of Envoys Amid Diplomatic Rift

author: Crystal-Rose Jones, Daniel Y. Teng
description: Here are 6 takeaways from David Crisafulli's speech to the American Chamber of Commerce in Australia.
title: Premier Pushes for Deeper US-Queensland Ties, Sees Opportunity With Trump Tariffs

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: After a tense infrastructure review, both the Queensland and federal governments agreed to a 50-50 funding split.
title: Australia Commits Largest-Ever Sports Infrastructure Spend to Brisbane Olympics

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The Orica Plant is expected to produce up to 4,700 tonnes of green hydrogen a year.
title: Australia Invests in $2B Green Hydrogen Push to Power Industry Without Fossil Fuels

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Albanese vows to cut red tape but keeps tax reform cards close.
title: Australian PM Backs ‘Australian Way’ at Economic Forum, Declines Tax Reform Commitments

author: Josh Spasaro
description: A Victorian conservative leader says he doesn't mind if his views align with the left, insisting the safety of society’s most vulnerable must come first.
title: Calls to Ban Men From Childcare Intensify After Alleged Sex Offender Charged in Melbourne

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: This comes after a worker was charged with abusing multiple children at a Melbourne centre.
title: Australia Eyes Surprise Inspections, CCTV in Childcare Centres After Abuse Case

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: This comes in response to allegations against a childcare worker in Melbourne’s west.
title: Childcare Abuse Scandal Triggers Urgent Review of Victorian Safety Standards

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A 14-year-old boy tragically lost his life in an e-bike crash in New South Wales.
title: Sydney Teenager Dies After Falling From E-bike

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The environment ministers of Alberta and Ontario sent a letter to Ottawa ahead of a July 2 and 3 conference between provincial and federal leaders in Yellowknife asking for the repeal of a number of Trudeau-era federal climate rules they say are slowing Canada’s economic growth. The letter, sent by Alberta’s Rebecca Schulz and Ontario’s […]
title: Alberta, Ontario Send Letter to Ottawa Demanding Rollback of Trudeau-Era Climate Policies

author: Chandra Philip
description: Two former United Conservative Party (UCP) MLAs who were removed from caucus are hoping to revive the Progressive Conservative Party of Alberta to challenge Premier Danielle Smith’s UCP. The PC Party was in power for more than 40 years in the province, losing in 2015 to the NDP under Rachel Notley. The party merged with […]
title: Former Alberta United Conservative MLAs Looking to Revive Provincial PC Party

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Calls to fix child safety checks went unanswered—now families are demanding answers.
title: Child Abuse Scandal Erupted in Melbourne Childcare Centre After State Ignored Warnings

author: Carolina Avendano
description: A forester who warned of Jasper wildfires back in 2017 says not enough work is being done for the rehabilitation of the areas impacted by last year’s blaze. He says the lack of measures may lead to more fire risks. Ken Hodges, a retired forester with more than 40 years of experience, says recovery efforts […]
title: Forester Who Warned of Jasper Wildfires Says More Action Needed to Rehabilitate Affected Areas

author: Chandra Philip
description: B.C.’s Infrastructure Minister Bowinn Ma says her office is still helping support residents in the North Vancouver community after explosions damaged the front door frame of her office and prompted a police investigation. North Vancouver RCMP said they were called out around 4:15 a.m. June 27 to investigate the explosion at a building at the […]
title: BC Minister Says Will Continue to Support Community as Police Investigate Explosion at Constituency Office

author: AAP
description: A man allegedly fired at officers before they returned fire.
title: Armed Man Shot Dead by Police After Seven-Hour Siege in Victoria
